original_title: Siyapatha Finance launches national school-level tree planting project marking two decades of growth
original_body_lines: Embodying two decades of growth and perseverance from its modest roots to service excellence, Siyapatha Finance PLC launched an islandwide school-level tree planting project and art competition in 20 schools across 13 regions.
Each participating school planted 20 Mee trees (Mahua longifolia) representing the company’s 20-year-long journey in the financial services industry.

Siyapatha Finance PLC Managing Director Ananda Seneviratne noted: “As we celebrate our 20th anniversary, we are pleased to launch this school-level tree planting project as a gesture of our gratitude to the environment. We need to constantly acknowledge that trees and nature are not only central to the survival of all living beings but vital for a sustainable future. And this project goes beyond merely planting trees – it is about bringing young minds together and empowering them to embrace the power nature holds in all of our lives.”

The art competition at the event opened an avenue for young talent to express their connection to nature through creativity. Each school selected 20 winners and distributed backpacks and certificates in recognition of their efforts.

The schools selected for the project were Ilukhena Gunananda Maha Vidyalaya, Kuliyapitiya; Kaluthara Maha Vidyalaya; Sri Medhankara Junior School, Yatiyana, Agalawatta; Matara Akuragoda Sulthanagoda Vidyalaya; R/EMB/ Modarawana School, Embilipitiya; Hewagama Kanitu Viduhala; Rukmale Maha Vidyalaya; Madhiwela Rahula Vidyalaya, Nugegoda; Karangawa Janarajya Vidyalaya, Ampara; Ramakrishna Mission Maha Vidyalayam, Akkaraipattu; Wijayabahupura Primary School, Polonnaruwa; Thiruvaiaru Maha Vidyalayam, Kilinochchi; Claverton Tamil Vidyalaya, Hatton; Kikiliyamanna Vidyalaya, Nuwara Eliya; Sri Palabaddala Maha Vidyalaya, Rathnapura; Ganthuna Kandurata Maha Vidyalaya, Kegalle; President Model Primary School, Pasyala; Ranpathwila Maha Vidyalaya / Kahatagasdigiliya, Anuradhapura; Witikuliya Central College, Nikaweratiya; and Puthukkudiyirippu Vani Vidyalaya, Valachchenai.
